data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: After years enjoying authentic Mexian food, we are woefully spoiled and hard pressed to find anything comparable in NH.

data.title: Love the shrimp tacos!
data.text: I really enjoy eating at this restaurant and do so about once a month.  The owner or manager is present every time and shows his pride in his business with the food he prepares.  I have never had anything there I did not like, abut the taco salads and shrimp tacos are the best to me.  If you like heat, try the habanero salsa.  If I had to add a negative, it is that there is always a new server, and they are not very friendly.   Otherwise, a great place to eat.

data.title: Good food, slow service
data.text: The food was amazing but the service was pretty bad. Was one of the best burritos I've had in Salinas but have had better. It's worth giving a shot.

data.title: Visited twice since last review - disappointed with the shrimp
data.text:
My partner and I have been back twice since my last review, and we were disappointed with the food. All else is the same - cold ambiance, great service.

Main problem (for us) with the shrimp dishes is that they are way too sweet; the sauce seems to be primarily commercial ketchup. I cannot recommend it over so many other places in Salinas that sell similar food.

data.title: Incredible Mexican Food
data.text:
I was in town on business and sought out this small restaurant in downtown Salinas.

It was well worth the trip; there is a wide variety of typical offerings, however, the owner has taken creative license in the creation I ordered--a mixture of shrimp, chicken and asada with cheese & a little bite. The flavored work well and is very popular.  Prices are VERY reasonable.

The ingredients are fresh and all items are made on site.

I recommend you try this gem if you are in the area--you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Wow. Great but for the ambience.
data.text:
The menu is thankfully short and focused. I will likely give this a higher rating with more experience with the choices.

The shrimp dish I had, cameron enchilados, was too sweet for my taste, yet the entire plate "worked". While I wouldn't order that dish again, I will definitely return to try other dishes, and just remember to ask about relative "sweetness", as opposed to "heat", which was lower than I was led to believe by the gracious server (yet I cannot fault her at all for that, because who can possibly know a stranger's taste for spice?!?)

The tables and chairs are, well, cold; functional, to be sure, but they lend an ambiance that simply does not jibe with the warmth and dedication of the chef and others. Sheesh, petty carp about a place I'll be going back to a lot.

data.title: Fresh and Tasty Chicken Taco Salad - Pica Fresh Mex on Main Street
data.text:
We enjoyed our early dinner here.  Its a cafe style with interesting pictures on the wall. 

There is chips and salsa to start.  I really liked their salsa.

For dinner, we had their chicken taco salad (very good) and an ice tea.

The flavors are fresh.  The prices are very reasonable.

Service is good.

Its a few minutes walk from the Steinbeck Center and is on Main Street.

data.title: They have the best mexican and the friendliest service!
data.text: I can not get enough of their food! Seriously tho, they have really great dishes and a friendly atmosphere.  Their prices can't be beat for the quality!

data.title: Fantastic lunch in downtown Salinas
data.text: It doesn't look like much but the food was fantastic and the service was great.  The Mix a'la Diabla was spicy with great flavor and came with homemade corn tortillas which were worth the trip alone.

data.title: Great food, friendly crew
data.text: My wife and I went here for a weekend lunch. We saw the pictures of food in the front of the building. The food pictures didn't look enticing but we went in anyway. Upon walking in, we didn't see may people dining in, the place relied on outside lightning as it seemed a bit dim inside, for us. We were greeted upon walking in and we could already feel the genuine friendly vibe although the person doing the cooking seemed a bit shy or not the smiling type. The menu has pictures too, same as the ones outside. The men's restroom is well lit, huge, and everything is in working order but could use some updating and some light cleaning-up. Our orders arrived quickly, were warm, delicious, and of was of the right portion. My wife thought that the food was great too. They constantly checked to see how we're doing and how the food was. Overall, well done, and recommendable!

data.title: Freshness you can taste!!
data.text: We came here based on other TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed. The food was fresh, you could taste the freshness, all homemade.  The prices were very reasonable, between $8 and $14.  The food was excellent and the service was good.  We had Asada Tacos, Sopes and Enchiladas and they were all great.  We will definitely return the next time in town.  If I lived in Salinas I would be a regular customer.

data.title: Love the shrimp
data.text: Quick service.  Good food.  The kids all love the shrimp!  Has a little bit of spice to it and lots of fresh flavors.  You can run in, grab a to go item and take to the movies right next door!

data.title: Fair to Good
data.text: Good service.  The food is "fair to good" and we eat here once in a while when I don't feel like cooking.  It's close to home and I've never been here when it's crowded.  There is a TV with a soccer game on.  They give a 10% discount if you show them your movie ticket.  They are next to the movie theatre downtown Salinas.

data.title: Best Mexican food in Monterey County and maybe California
data.text: I've been coming here for years, including when it was called Habanero's.  Thankfully they've kept the same recipes the whole time.  I never knew I could like rice and beans so much!  The shrimp tacos are the best, but the veggie burritos are also good, as are the fish tacos.  Ask for the green salsa if they've got it (an avocado concoction that's more salsa than guacamole), or for the pico de gallo.  I would give this restaurant a 5-star rating, but I think 5-star ratings should be saved for fancy, special restaurants, not fast food joints like this.  However, the food and value at Pica are definitely 5 stars!

data.title: Delish
data.text: great. Food was very good i personally. Love the burritos the employees. Are great their personality. Is very good keep up the great job

data.title: i was surprised...
data.text: with these positive reviews that the place wasn't busier.  I have eaten there twice and it  was excellent both times.  The staff was very pleasant about telling me the special for the night and bringing a little bit in a cup for me to taste it.  The chips and salsa were good as was the house (red) wine.  I even had the dessert, sopapillas, which was excellente!!  Easy parking on the main street...You can be certain when I go back to Salinas I will eat here!

data.title: Ate here two nights in a row!!!! :)
data.text: I went to Salinas w/my friend & my 4 year old daughter. My friend wanted to check out Pica because she heard/saw good things about it online. Well, let me tell you....we were SOOOO impressed we went back again the next night! The staff is friendly, nice, & welcoming. The chips & salsa are both home-made and DELICIOUS! Our dinners were cooked to perfection & seriously tasted like we were in the heart of Mexico....talk about authenticity! Their prices are VERY reasonable! They even provided a plastic cup w/a lid for my daughter....as a parent, that's HUGE! My only regret....is we weren't staying for a 3rd night!!!  Can't wait to come back to Pica! Enjoy friends!  :)

data.title: My new favorite place EVER!
data.text: What can I say, authentic, yummy, great service, great food in downtown area.  Will definetly eat here every time I come to salinas!

data.title: Great food great prices
data.text:
Was recommended by front desk staff at Best 5 Hotel to try this place to eat. 

Nice location in downtown which was charming. Food was amazing. Authentic Mexican with an American twist. The hot sauce was flaming but the food was delicious. The staff was welcoming and kind. Only issue was the place seemed kinda dead. Needed music and more patrons. Must've been an off night. Definitely a great meal at great prices. Loved it!

data.title: Great family owned restaurant!
data.text: We went here based on reviews we saw posted. My boyfriend and I were glad we did. We walked in around 9pm, and were immediately welcomed. We ordered brochetas (unsure of spelling) and steak tacos. Also, the salsa, chips and guac were free which was a major plus! Total for our dinner : $25!
